name: unstratified
content:
unstratified adjective
(ENVIRONMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
geology, environment
  specialized not consisting of separate layers: Boulder clay consists of an unstratified and unsorted deposit of clay, sand, gravel, and boulders. The authors studied the unstratified upper layer of the rainforest canopy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe sediment used in the models is unstratified.Researchers investigated the distribution of phytoplankton in unstratified water.

unstratified adjective
(PEOPLE)
social science
  specialized not having people or things arranged according to their importance, level, or type: Until recently, these groups have remained an unstratified, egalitarian society. The sample was unstratified.
More examplesFewer examplesFigure 3 shows the association of social capital with psychological health for the unstratified sample (men and women).These communities were not unstratified - boys from families without cattle herded cattle belonging to other families.
